sentences.en: Crocker's detractors and critics have accused him of melodramatics, [18] histrionics, [16] and using Spears' personal shortcomings to bolster his own fame.[19]
sentences.cn: Crocker的贬低和批评者指责他装腔作势、表演和利用布兰妮个人的缺点来达到自己出名的目的。

sentences.en: Somehow all this anguish and excitement, all the grief and histrionics, only whetted my appetite.
sentences.cn: 不知怎么搞的,她所有这些痛苦和激动 、 所有的悲伤和做作只是激发了我的欲望.

sentences.en: There were no histrionics, no climbing through the stands to greet her family and friends. Instead, Li sat calmly on her chair and let it all sink in.
sentences.cn: 没有胜利后的表演，也没有翻过看台向家人和朋友致意，相反，李娜平静地深深坐进了椅子里。

sentences.en: These squabbling Tolstoys and their stilted histrionics were conceited and exasperating.
sentences.cn: 这些斗嘴的托尔斯泰们和他们夸张的表演真令人恼火。

sentences.en: When I explained every-thing to my mum and dad, there were no histrionics.
sentences.cn: 我一五一十地把一切都向父母解释清楚了。

words.tran_cn: 装腔作势的态度或举止；舞台艺术；表演（histrionic的复数）

trans.tran_cn: （用作单数）戏剧表演，舞台艺术，（常复数）装模做样
